New Records: England become the first men's team to hold the 20-over and 50-over titles at the same time
Key Match Events: England beat Pakistan by five wickets to claim second T20 world title
Stokes shows trademark calm to hit unbeaten fifty in nervy chase
Pakistan scrape to 137-8 off their 20 overs
Curran takes sublime 3-12, Rashid & Jordan claim two each, Stokes one
Post-Match Reflections: England's Chris Woakes: 'We have lost a lot of games in Australia but to win here at the MCG is amazing.'

England all-rounder Moeen Ali: 'This is one of the best days of my career. We deserved it over a long period of time, we've played some amazing cricket but fell short in the semis last year. Now we have done it against an amazing Pakistan side in front of all these fans.'
England opener Alex Hales: 'I definitely didn't think playing for England would come around again. The last 6-8 weeks have been so enjoyable and this is the icing on the cake.'
England batter Harry Brook: 'So good. A lot of people would not expect to win a World Cup at 23 but being in this squad I always thought we would win it. We showed the world how good we are.'
England all-rounder Ben Stokes: 'The way the bowlers bowled meant we didn't feel under too much pressure with the run chase. It never felt out of our hands.'
England's Sam Curran: 'This is very special. I don't think I should be getting this (player of the match) the way Stokesy played, to get a 50 in the final. We are going to enjoy this occasion.'
Pakistan captain Babar Azam: 'First of all congratulations to England, they deserve to be champions.'
England coach Matthew Mott: 'I would like to say it was easy but we did it the hard way. The boys held their nerve and got a great result.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ravi Bopara: 'Franchise cricket has helped England'

Ravi Bopara: 'One of the great things to come from this World Cup is the teams we thought were the lesser teams, we've seen how much they've improved. The likes of Ireland and Zimbabwe have caught up - I just want to say a massive well done to them.'
